intro: Sphaerostephanos hernaezii, commonly known as the Hérnandez's spherical star, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its unique, spherical inflorescence composed of tightly packed, small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in sunny, arid environments. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a compact, low-growing habit. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
